pages.text: Rubidgea is a gorgonopsid from the Permian period whose fossils have been found in Tanzania and South Africa. It was a large bodied gorgonopsid that could grow up to 3.4 meters long and had thick saber like canines and are characterized by a robust build. Rubidgea was a fierce predator and would have roamed the wooded areas of its environment in search for prey.
